definitions: thick stiff paper material made from pressed layers of paper pulp
examples: We packed the fragile items in cardboard boxes
The children made a fort out of large cardboard sheets

definitions: knitted sweater that opens at the front with buttons or zipper
examples: She wore a cozy cardigan over her dress
My grandmother knitted me a wool cardigan for winter

definitions: senior official in the Roman Catholic Church ranking below the Pope
bright red North American songbird with a distinctive crest
examples: The cardinal conducted the special mass at the cathedral
Cardinals advise the Pope on important church matters
A cardinal perched on the bird feeder this morning
The male cardinal has bright red feathers while females are brown

definitions: medical doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating diseases of the heart
examples: The cardiologist recommended surgery to repair the damaged valve
She was referred to a cardiologist after experiencing chest pains

definitions: branch of medicine that deals with diseases and abnormalities of the heart and blood vessels
examples: He decided to specialize in cardiology during medical school
The hospital's cardiology department has state-of-the-art equipment

definitions: person who provides direct care for children, elderly, or disabled individuals
examples: The caregiver helped her elderly mother with daily activities
Professional caregivers receive special training in patient care

definitions: person employed to look after a building or property
person temporarily performing the duties of an office or position
examples: The school caretaker arrived early to unlock the gates
The caretaker maintained the grounds of the estate beautifully
A caretaker government was appointed until new elections could be held
She served as caretaker manager while they searched for a replacement

definitions: goods carried on a ship, aircraft, or motor vehicle for commercial purposes
examples: The ship's cargo included electronics and textiles from Asia
Cargo planes transport goods faster than container ships

definitions: large deer of Arctic regions with branched antlers in both sexes
examples: The caribou migrate thousands of miles across the tundra
Indigenous peoples have hunted caribou for centuries

definitions: picture or description that exaggerates certain features for comic or satirical effect
examples: The political caricature emphasized the senator's large nose
Street artists drew caricatures of tourists for twenty dollars

definitions: artist who specializes in drawing exaggerated portraits for humorous or satirical effect
examples: The caricaturist captured her personality in just a few strokes
Political caricaturists often work for newspapers and magazines

definitions: quality of showing kindness and concern for others through thoughtful actions and emotional support
examples: Her caring nature made her an excellent nurse
The community showed its caring through donations to the family

definitions: vivid crimson color originally made from crushed cochineal insects
examples: The artist mixed carmine with white to create pink
Her lipstick was a bold carmine shade

definitions: great destruction of life through violence, especially in war or accident
examples: The battlefield carnage was worse than anyone had anticipated
Emergency workers arrived at the scene of highway carnage

definitions: cultivated plant with fragrant ruffled flowers in various colors including pink, red, and white
examples: He wore a red carnation in his lapel at the wedding
Carnations are popular Mother's Day flowers because they last long

definitions: public festival featuring processions, music, dancing, and often masks and costumes
examples: The Rio carnival attracts millions of visitors each year
Children enjoyed rides and games at the summer carnival

definitions: animal that feeds primarily or exclusively on meat from other animals
examples: Lions are carnivores that hunt in groups called prides
Some plants are carnivores that trap and digest insects

definitions: religious song traditionally sung at Christmas or other festive occasions
examples: We sang carols around the neighborhood on Christmas Eve
Silent Night is one of the most beloved Christmas carols

definitions: revolving platform with seats shaped like horses or other animals for children to ride
examples: The children begged for another ride on the carousel
The antique carousel featured hand-carved wooden horses

definitions: large freshwater fish with barbels around the mouth commonly found in rivers and ponds
examples: Anglers caught several carp in the lake this morning
Koi are ornamental varieties of carp bred for their colors

definitions: skilled worker who makes and repairs wooden structures and objects
examples: The carpenter built custom cabinets for our kitchen
She apprenticed with a master carpenter to learn the trade

definitions: skilled trade of cutting, shaping, and installing wood for construction
examples: He learned carpentry from his father who was a builder
The carpentry work on the historic house was exceptionally detailed

definitions: thick woven material used as a permanent floor covering stretched wall to wall
examples: They replaced the old carpeting with hardwood floors
The plush carpeting muffled footsteps in the hallway

definitions: wheeled vehicle pulled by horses for transporting people
way a person holds and moves their body when standing or walking
examples: The wedding couple rode away in a horse-drawn carriage
Tourists enjoyed carriage rides through the historic district
Her elegant carriage showed years of ballet training
Good carriage is important for preventing back problems

definitions: part of a road intended for vehicles, especially one side of a divided highway
examples: The accident blocked the northbound carriageway for two hours
Emergency vehicles used the opposite carriageway to reach the scene

definitions: decaying flesh of dead animals that serves as food for scavengers
examples: Vultures circled above the carrion in the desert
The smell of carrion attracted flies and other insects

definitions: orange root vegetable rich in vitamins commonly eaten raw or cooked
examples: She added diced carrots to the vegetable soup
Rabbits in cartoons always seem to be eating carrots

definitions: association of manufacturers or suppliers formed to maintain prices and restrict competition
examples: The oil cartel controlled global petroleum prices for decades
Government investigators uncovered evidence of an illegal price-fixing cartel

definitions: tough elastic tissue found in joints and other body parts that cushions bones
examples: The surgeon repaired torn cartilage in the athlete's knee
Shark skeletons are made entirely of cartilage instead of bone

definitions: person who draws or produces maps using geographic data and artistic skills
examples: The cartographer created detailed maps of the newly explored region
Ancient cartographers often included mythical creatures on their maps

definitions: science and art of drawing maps including techniques for accurate geographic representation
examples: She studied cartography to combine her love of geography and art
Modern cartography uses satellite data and computer software

definitions: light cardboard or plastic box used for storing or transporting goods
examples: She bought a carton of milk from the grocery store
Empty egg cartons can be used for craft projects

definitions: artist who draws cartoons for newspapers, magazines, books, or animated films
examples: The political cartoonist won a Pulitzer Prize for her work
Many cartoonists now publish their comics directly online

definitions: container holding a charge and bullet for firearms
replaceable container with ink, toner, or other substance for printers
examples: The hunter loaded fresh cartridges into his rifle
Spent cartridges littered the shooting range floor
The printer needs a new ink cartridge to continue printing
She recycled the empty toner cartridge at the office

definitions: gymnastic movement where the body rotates sideways with hands and feet touching ground alternately
examples: The children practiced cartwheels on the soft grass
She could do perfect cartwheels across the gymnasium floor

definitions: person who cuts or shapes wood, stone, or other materials into decorative objects
examples: The wood carver created intricate figurines from single blocks
Traditional carvers passed their skills through generations

definitions: object or design cut from wood, stone, or other material as decoration or art
examples: The intricate carving on the temple door depicted ancient stories
He collected Native American carvings from the Pacific Northwest

definitions: waterfall or series of small waterfalls flowing over rocks
examples: The cascade tumbled down the mountainside into a pool below
Water formed a beautiful cascade over the garden rocks

definitions: lockable metal box used for storing cash and coins in shops or offices
examples: The cashier counted money from the cashbox at closing time
They kept the cashbox in a secure drawer under the counter

definitions: kidney-shaped nut that grows on tropical trees, commonly eaten roasted or used in cooking
examples: She added cashews to the stir-fry for extra crunch
Cashew butter is a creamy alternative to peanut butter

definitions: person who handles payments and receipts in a shop, bank, or business
examples: The cashier scanned items quickly during the lunch rush
She worked as a cashier while attending college classes

definitions: soft fine wool obtained from Kashmir goats used to make luxury clothing
examples: Her cashmere sweater felt incredibly soft against her skin
Genuine cashmere scarves can be quite expensive

definitions: protective outer covering or shell that encloses something fragile or mechanical
examples: The metal casing protected the delicate electronics inside
Sausage casing is traditionally made from animal intestines

definitions: large wooden barrel used for storing and aging wine, beer, or spirits
examples: The whiskey aged in oak casks for twelve years
Workers rolled heavy casks into the wine cellar

definitions: rectangular box in which a dead person is buried or cremated
examples: The mahogany casket was adorned with brass handles
Mourners filed past the open casket to pay their respects

definitions: tropical plant with starchy tuberous roots used as food, especially in Africa and South America
examples: Cassava flour is used to make traditional flatbreads
Farmers harvest cassava roots after eight months of growth

definitions: baked dish containing meat, vegetables, and sauce cooked slowly in the oven
examples: She prepared a chicken casserole for the potluck dinner
The casserole bubbled in the oven filling the kitchen with aroma
